alert.note: Alert for Gibson (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 07 at 12:02AM EST until March 14 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana... Patoka River near Princeton. .Recent and future rainfall in the Patoka River basin will cause the river to rise. At Princeton, the river is expected to rise above flood stage tonight. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH MONDAY, MARCH 14... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Patoka River near Princeton. * WHEN...Until Monday, March 14. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:45 PM CST Sunday the stage was 17.7 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage late this evening to 18.3 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall to 18.1 feet and begin rising again early Tuesday morning. It will rise to 19.0 feet early Saturday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Monday, March 14. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
